org.orgName: The United States Circuit Court for the District of Washington

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION
In the Matter of the Application of James P. Lavin and Sister Superior M. Angelique, for a writ of Certiorari}
In the Matter of the Application of Yvonne Le Fevre, Georgette Normand and Marie Le Fevre for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
United States of America District of Washington} SS.

Edward E. Cushman, being first duly sworn, on oath says: That he is the Assistant United States Attorney and attorney for the petitioners, James P. Lavin and Sister Superior M. Angelique, above named; that heretofore, to-wit, on the 14th day of February, 1903, a writ of certiorari issued out of this Court directed to the Superior Court of the State of Washington for King County, a copy of which said writ is hereto attached; that said writ was served by U.S. Marshall by delivering to and depositing with the Clerk of said Superior Court a copy thereof; that said writ was complied with by said Court and the Clerk thereof, by filing in this Court a record of the proceedings had in the State Court, but ommiting to return the writ of certiorari thereto.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 3rd day of March, 1903
A Reeves Avres Clerk US Circuit Court Dist of Washington by RM Hopkins Deputy
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court, DIST. OF WASHINGTON MAR 5 1903 A. REVES AYRES, Clerk HM Walthew Dep
